utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It's nice to meet you. What's your name?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It my name is Scott. It's nice to meet you too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, um so Scott. How old are you?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, What brings you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I've had a sore throat now for a couple of weeks and it's just not going away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Couple of weeks. OK, so about two weeks, three weeks?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, about two to three weeks.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um what does it feel like is it, is it kind of like a burning feeling? Is it more like an itchy feeling? What does it feel like?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh I would say it's kinda yeah like burnin' or burning or scratchy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and does it hurt when you swallow?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It does, yeah, uh, If my throat hurts when I'm eating or Um uh or swallowing like liquid's as well, but cold stuff seems to make it feel a little bit better.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good, and does your neck hurt too?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um. A little tender, I've noticed the um some lumps at the front of front of my neck that have been a bit sore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it mostly sore, kind of like midline? Or is it more sorta one side versus the other?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I'd say, maybe the, uh, the right side is a little bit more sore, but I think I can feel it on both sides of my neck.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how bad would you say your discomfort is 1 to 10, 10 being the worst.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um. I would say maybe a two or three if I move my neck I I can feel it more, but otherwise I can just barely notice that it's there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, so it's not preventing you from sleeping, going to school, playing, things like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's more so the sore throat when swallowing.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK. Um, have you noticed a fever at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I have. Yeah I felt hot and Um I checked my temperature this morning and it was 38.7 I think it was. Is that a fever?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, I'd say that's a fever. We can also do another temperature check today.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Um yeah, but that definitely sounds like a fever. Um, have you noticed rashes anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um Yeah, I've had this, uh this, like red I guess pink rash that I have noticed it's come over my chest and and belly area.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how big is it? Is it more than a centimeter?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh huh. Yeah, it's pretty well, I mean, it's kind of, um spread out over over an area like it's not all continuous I guess. You can kind of see patches or blotches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and, is it raised?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it's it's not raised.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. OK, is it itchy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, no, it's not itchy.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Painful?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not painful.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and is it bleeding or oozing anything like pus?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no it's not, nothing like that, it's just pink and red and it's just kind of shown up over the last little while. I've noticed it on my um like hands a little bit too.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and you said this started when like was this before the sore throat or after?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh I can't like remember the onset. I I think that the sore throat started first and maybe a rash came a little bit later.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK and have you noticed that your that your glands are swollen?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think so, um maybe that's what's swollen in my neck.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Um how about coughing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I haven't had a cough no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And how about a stuffy nose or or a runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, body aches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I felt so some muscle aches for sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, upper limbs or lower limbs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I say I got a whole body, I just feel like my muscles and joints are sore.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, yeah, and or do you have any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh. No, I haven't really had any headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK. And how's your appetite? Are you still eating well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um. It might be a little ah might have been a little bit down. I just kind of haven't been feeling so great, so I'm I've probably eating less the last few weeks, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you been around anyone who may have been sick recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, actually I think a few of my friends or there was somebody in my gym class knew that I sounded like they had similar symptoms.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and when was this?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, Uh, now that I think about it, probably about three or four weeks ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and were they ever treated for that? Did they see a doctor?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I'm not sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK. No worries.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I just remember them being off for school 'cause they were they were sick.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK yeah, any issues with your eyes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, nothing like crusting or pus coming out of your eyes? Red eye, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um. No, that well, did they might have looked maybe a little bit more more red, red then usual but I haven't noticed any anything in terms of itchiness or um discharge.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no nausea or vomiting.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, how how about your stools? Have they been normal? Have you had diarrhea, constipation, anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No changes to bowel habits.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK how about urine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, that's been OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Um, have you ever had these symptoms before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I mean I've had sore throats in the past, but not while feeling like this though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah. OK, when was the last time you had a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I don't know maybe when I was a kid.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's been awhile.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, like a strep throat kind of thing, or or more viral?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I do remember getting antibiotics when I was younger.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and are you otherwise healthy? Do you have any medical conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I was diagnosed with uh with asthma.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and are you on any medications for that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah, so I, I just use ah Ventolin as needed, but otherwise oh and then I take Flovent daily so um.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think that's the one, there's there's a couple inhalers that that I take.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, and any other medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, sometimes I'll take um like Reactine or some other type of allergy pill, but that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, What are you allergic too?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um mostly seasonal allergies, bug me like um yeah, like seasonal allergies and dust, maybe.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And are you up to date with all your immunizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, my mom makes me get the flu shot every year.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good. And it's, OK, have you seen another doctor for the symptoms at all? Have you been worked up for that? Any blood work testing done for it already?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I thought I would have felt better by now and so I haven't seen anybody but it's kind of just been going on now, not seeming to get better. So wanna come see somebody.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah for sure. Have you tried anything for your symptoms? Any medications, anything over the counter?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah, I've tried some Tylenol and it's, I I think what is it Advil? And that definitely is helped with some of the kind of aches and pains, but they've come right back.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, um any family history of Lung issues, heart issues?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, No. nothing like that, um no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, OK. How about cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I, I think my Grandfather had a like pancreatic cancer.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK. Um, alright, so do you live at home correct?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I live with my parents and my younger sister. She's 12.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: She's 12, Is she healthy?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah she is.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, good and have you guys traveled recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um no we've been, we've been at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK, Um, and do you smoke?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't smoke.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, How about marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I I've tried it once or twice but it was just those couple times, nothing that I do or used regularly.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, And how about alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no alcohol.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No alcohol. OK, are you sexually active?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I'm not.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK um. Is there a possibility that? Or actually sorry I should rephrase that. Have you kissed anyone recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um I. Well, I I guess I kinda have a girlfriend now. Um that we, that I started hanging out with about two months ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: And so I guess yes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, alright, well that's good. Um have, has she had any of these symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, well she she was, wasn't feeling well for awhile back, but, I don't think it was this bad for her.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Actually, and she's better now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, she's better now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Alright, so you mentioned you're not sexually active. If you were to be, make sure you use protection. Um and OK. So everything at home is OK then? No ones, no ones sick at home you mentioned, right?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, no ones, no ones sick at home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And school is going OK?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um yeah, schools been been going OK for the most part it's been tough these last few weeks feeling like this though.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah for sure. And are you and your girlfriend in an exclusive relationship?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh. I I think so yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I ask because there's something called what you may be familiar with um it's called the kissing disease. In medical terminology, it's called mono, as caused by a virus called EBV, and so it could be that so we're covering all our bases.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, I've heard of mono before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah,

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: OK.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It's it's likely it could be up there in terms of what you have, so I think those were all the questions I had for you. Did you have any questions for me? Anything you wanted to add?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no, I think that's you covered everything.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK alright so I will will go off a few, we'll try to cover our basis and get you tested for mono which I would have to do like a monospot test and we can do rapid strep test as well to see if he has something called strep throat. But yeah, we'll see what those results come back as. And we'll go from there. Does that sound good?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, no, that sounds good.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
